modules.description: This module implements a lexer for parsing input into tokens, specifically handling line tracking and lexing operations. It works with `Lexing.lexbuf` and `Odiff_parser.token` types, using predefined lexing tables for efficient token recognition. Concrete use cases include reading and processing input streams for a parser, such as tokenizing source code or structured text formats.

Parses diff output into structured data by converting lexed tokens into a list of changes. It handles tokens representing line indices, additions, deletions, and separators, mapping them to a typed representation of file differences. Useful for processing version control diff formats into actionable change sets.

This module defines types for representing and manipulating differences between two files. It includes variants for additions, deletions, and changes, with precise line indexing to track modifications. These types are used to model the structure of file diffs, enabling operations like parsing, comparing, and formatting differences in text files.

This module computes and manipulates differences between files or strings, producing structured output in the form of diff lists. It supports operations to compute differences using external diff tools, parse diff output from strings, files, or channels, and print diffs in human-readable formats. Concrete use cases include comparing text files for version control, generating patch-like output between two string inputs, and analyzing changes in configuration files.
